titlestmt.titleproper: Robert Chase Lane ministerial log book, 1952-2008.
titlestmt.author: Patrick Riordan

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday May 10, 2022 at 17:29

did.unittitle: Robert Chase Lane ministerial log book, 1952-2008.
did.abstract: Rev. Robert C. Lane served as minister in Baraboo, WI in 1952, North Branford, CT in 1957, and Enfield, CT between 1967 and 1990, when he retired. During his retirement, he was an active member in the First Church of Windsor where he worked to make the church more welcoming to LGBT individuals. This collection records his work through the marital records he produced as a pastor.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in Robert Chase Lane ministerial log book, 1952-2008. MS5417. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by Janet Lane in September 2021; 2020-14.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: The original copy of this item is held by the archives of the Hartford International University for Religion and Peace, along with some other materials relating to Rev. Robert Lane.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Patrick Riordan, May 2022, using DACS 2019.03.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rev. Robert Lane was born in Milford, NH on November 23, 1925. He majored in math at Amherst College. During World War II, he enlisted into the army and was stationed in Japan for two years. Afterwards, he trained for the ministry at the Hartford Seminary (now the Hartford International University for Religion and Peace) and was ordained in 1952. Robert Lane served as minister in Baraboo, WI, in 1952, North Branford, CT, in 1957, and Enfield, CT, between 1967 and 1990, when he retired. During his retirement, he was an active member in the First Church of Windsor where he worked to make the church more welcoming to LGBT individuals, leading the process for 30 Connecticut churches to earn the "Open and Affirming" title. He died in 2016 at the age of 90.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection records the work of Rev. Robert Lane through the marital records he produced as a pastor.
